result.execSummary:
All charges against Zandrell C. Besaw in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zandrell C. Besaw is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:25 pm - Anthony Lambrecht, Ass't. D.A. appearing for the State of Wisconsin, in person.  Defendant, Zandrell Besaw appearing in person, in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.  Defendant states that his mother is telling him that Attorney Jaconi  has been retained.  We have no retainer from Atty. Jaconi and Atty. Jaconi is not appearing today.  Defendant is to verify with his family if this attorney has actually been retained or not.  Initial appearance is reset to 06-13-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant requesting bail reduction.
Initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:14 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Zandrell Besaw appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  The defendant states that Attorney Jevon Jaconi represents him.  Initial appearance is reset to 06-06-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.

ADDRESS INFO for Zandrell C. Besaw
Current: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 05-20-2022)
Prior: 951 Shawano Avenue, Green Bay, WI
RE: Deliver Fentanyl-2nd or subsequent offense, on 03-30-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of child neglect, 3 cts. possess Fentanyl within 1000 feet of school as repeater and deliver Fentanyl within 1000 feet of park as repeater.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 05-23-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $100,000.00 cash with the conditions that have no contact with any known drug users or dealers, that he not travel outside the State of Wisconsin without court permission and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
